description.narrative: Projektet syftar till att stärka demokratiska strukturer genom att arbeta för starka, ansvarstagande och transparenta institutioner. Ett annat fokus är på områden där privat och offentlig sektor överlappar varandra.

The project focuses on Strengthening democratic order in Georgia by promoting strong, open and accountable institutions embedded in a functioning system of checks and balances. In addition, another focus area is shedding light on areas where government and private sector overlap.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The main outcomes of the reporting period are: 1. Improved anti-corruption framework: such as the introduction of a verification procedure for the asset declarations of public officials and stronger protection for whistleblowers, as well as the adoption of an improved National Anti-Corruption Strategy and Action Plan. 2. Advocating for legislative changes in the Parliament: TI Georgia provided comprehensive analysis of over 20 draft laws initiated in the Parliament. 3. New regulations for the banking and finance sector: TI Georgia elaborated joint recommendations with other stakeholders, which were taken into account when the law was passed. 4. Promoting transparency, accountability and citizen engagement: TI Georgia was part of the first parliamentary inter-faction working group, composed of faction and civil society representatives which drafted the first Open Parliament Action Plan for the Parliament. Moreover, the Parliament has taken into consideration a number of recommendations from TI Georgia’s annual Parliamentary Performance Report, such as improving the usability and accessibility of information on the official parliamentary webpage and boosting the amount of timely and precisely published parliamentary information. 5. Helped safeguard the independence of the Supreme Audit Office: TI Georgia helped alleviate unwarranted pressure on the Supreme Audit Office (SAO) by demonstrating the depth and breadth of SAOs audits in 2013. 6. Helped raise public awareness against the changes to the law on National Bank stripping the National Bank of its banking supervision. 7. Increased Transparency of local municipalities: TI Georgia’s regional staff advocacy activities have led to the City Councils in several municipalities to increase their budgets for homeless and socially vulnerable persons. Particular improvements were made in Zugdidi, Kutaisi, Kobuleti, Batumi, Abasha municipalities. 8. Increased citizen’s engagement on local issues: Through a fora organized by the TI Georgia Batumi office representatives of the Adjarian government and the Ministry of Energy, the local public was informed about the plans related to infrastructure projects. During the forum, it was agreed that the local government will provide information about every detail of the project to the local residents prior to commencement of new works. 9. Improved internal regulations: As a result of advocacy carried out by TI Georgia Zugdidi office, the Zugdidi Council took into account its recommendations and adopted new rules which includes written reasoning/justification before deciding on bonuses. 10. Contributed to developing a fair and impartial public service in municipalities: TI Georgia successfully challenged illegal dismissal and prejudiced hiring practices of civil servants by local government authorities. As a result, 49 individuals were restored to their positions and/or have received compensation, and municipalities are required to duly justify their decision. Additionally 7 municipalities in Imereti and Samegrelo have changed their arbitrary practices and attached performance-based criteria for distribution of bonuses. 11. Restoration of Property Rights of Individuals: 48 cases were successfully challenged at various courts. 12. Revolving Door: Significant progress has been achieved in improving the regulatory framework of revolving door and the broader issue of insulating public administration from the undue influence of private interests. 13. Increased transparency of judicial decisions: TI Georgia has created Supreme Court’s Most Important Interpretations Search System . This system is publicly accessible and allows any stakeholder or interested individual to search for information on cases and interpretations of law, contributing to increased judicial accountability.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
